dublinCore.dc:title: 114 HR 217 RH: Communities Helping Invest through Property and Improvements Needed for Veterans Act of 2025
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Bacon introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs
Additional sponsors: Mr. Gottheimer, Mr. Wittman, Mr. Valadao, Ms. Lee of Nevada, Mr. Thanedar, and Mr. Vindman
Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
action.action-instruction: Strike out all after the enacting clause and insert the part printed in italic
For text of introduced bill, see copy of bill as introduced on January 7, 2025

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to make permanent the pilot program authorized by the Communities Helping Invest through Property and Improvements Needed for Veterans Act of 2016, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Communities Helping Invest through Property and Improvements Needed for Veterans Act of 2025 or the CHIP IN for Veterans Act of 2025.

section.header: Expanding and extending a pilot program on acceptance by the Department of Veterans Affairs of donated facilities and related improvements

paragraph.text: Section 2 of the Communities Helping Invest through Property and Improvements Needed for Veterans Act of 2016 (Public Law 114–294; 38 U.S.C. 8103 note) is amended, in subsection (a)(1)—

subparagraph.text: in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by striking property; and
by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:
A minor construction, or nonrecurring maintenance, project of the Department.

clause.text: in the heading, by striking of property;
in the matter preceding paragraph (1), by striking the donation of a property and inserting a donation;
in paragraph (1), by inserting or project after property each place it appears; and
in paragraph (2), by inserting project, after improvements,;

subclause.text: in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by striking real property and improvements donated under the pilot program and inserting a donation;
in subparagraph (A), by striking ; or and inserting a semicolon;
in subparagraph (B), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; or; and
by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

subparagraph.text: the performance of a minor construction, or nonrecurring maintenance, project of the Department.

subclause.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking construction of the facility and inserting donation;
in subparagraph (B), by inserting maintaining, after altering,; and
in subparagraph (C), by striking construction of the facility and inserting donation;

clause.text: by inserting alter, maintain, after design, both places it appears;

subclause.text: by striking real property and improvements donated and inserting a donation; and
by striking of the real property and improvements; and

clause.text: in subparagraph (B)(ii)(I), by striking construction and donation of the real property and improvements and inserting donation; and

subparagraph.text: in subsection (g)(1), by striking real property and improvements donated and inserting donations.

subsection.text: Such section is further amended, in subsection (i), by striking December 16, 2026 and inserting December 16, 2031.

endorsement.action-desc: Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
